item.title: How Smartphones Are Making Kids Unhappy
item.description: August 7, 2017 - Psychologist Jean Twenge has observed dramatic shifts in behavior among children who go through adolescence with smartphones. They're spending less time with friends and reporting greater anxiety.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 7, 2017 - Psychologist Jean Twenge has observed dramatic shifts in behavior among children who go through adolescence with smartphones. They're spending less time with friends and reporting greater anxiety. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/07/542016165/how-smartphones-are-making-kids-unhappy

item.title: Google Engineer's Criticism Of Diversity Programs Sparks Controversy
item.description: August 7, 2017 - A Google engineer's critique of the company's diversity programs is stoking controversy. The male engineer wrote that women aren't suited for tech jobs for "biological" reasons. Google executives are now trying to tamp down the furor as the memo ricochets around the tech industry and beyond.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 7, 2017 - A Google engineer's critique of the company's diversity programs is stoking controversy. The male engineer wrote that women aren't suited for tech jobs for "biological" reasons. Google executives are now trying to tamp down the furor as the memo ricochets around the tech industry and beyond. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/07/542087066/google-engineers-criticism-of-diversity-programs-sparks-controversy

item.title: Google Grapples With Fallout After Employee Slams Diversity Efforts
item.description: August 7, 2017 - In a 3,300-word document that has been shared across Google's internal networks, an engineer at the company said "biological causes" are part of the reason women aren't represented equally.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 7, 2017 - In a 3,300-word document that has been shared across Google's internal networks, an engineer at the company said "biological causes" are part of the reason women aren't represented equally. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/07/542020041/google-grapples-with-fallout-after-employee-slams-diversity-efforts

item.title: Brush Yourself Off And Try Again: An Invention Story
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Inventing even the simplest product is a fraught process. Mike Davidson and Mike Smith have learned that lesson the hard way as they seek to change the way teeth get cleaned.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Inventing even the simplest product is a fraught process. Mike Davidson and Mike Smith have learned that lesson the hard way as they seek to change the way teeth get cleaned. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/04/536835736/brush-yourself-off-and-try-again-an-invention-story

item.title: Technology Gets Under The Skin
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Last week, a Wisconsin company offered its employees the option to have a chip inserted into their bodies in an effort to help them navigate the workplace. Alva Noë asks: What's the big deal?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Last week, a Wisconsin company offered its employees the option to have a chip inserted into their bodies in an effort to help them navigate the workplace. Alva Noë asks: What's the big deal? http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/04/541106998/technology-gets-under-the-skin

item.title: Behind China's VPN Crackdown, A 'Game Of Cat And Mouse' Continues
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Savvy Internet users in China can tunnel under the "Great Firewall" using virtual private networks. Even as the government finds new methods to block VPNs, providers find ways to go around the blocks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Savvy Internet users in China can tunnel under the "Great Firewall" using virtual private networks. Even as the government finds new methods to block VPNs, providers find ways to go around the blocks. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/04/541554438/behind-chinas-vpn-crackdown-a-game-of-cat-and-mouse-continues

item.title: Hyperloop Tests Magnetic Levitation At 192 MPH
item.description: August 4, 2017 - David Greene speaks with Hyperloop One co-founder Josh Giegel about the logistical and political challenges involved in building the high speed transportation system in California.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - David Greene speaks with Hyperloop One co-founder Josh Giegel about the logistical and political challenges involved in building the high speed transportation system in California. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/04/541538743/hyperloop-tests-magnetic-levitation-at-192-mph

item.title: Feds Arrest Man Credited With Helping To Stop Ransomware Attack
item.description: August 3, 2017 - The Justice Department alleges Marcus Hutchins, who is said to have short-circuited WannaCry's global attack, created another malware program. His supporters say DOJ couldn't be more wrong.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - The Justice Department alleges Marcus Hutchins, who is said to have short-circuited WannaCry's global attack, created another malware program. His supporters say DOJ couldn't be more wrong. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/03/541447479/feds-arrest-man-credited-with-helping-to-stop-ransomware-attack

item.title: From Family Snapshots To NASA Photos, Archivists Aim To Solve Preservation Puzzles
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Levi Bettwieser develops found film rolls from his Idaho home, and Dennis Wingo helped rescue early pictures of the moon. But what will happen when historical photos go from analog to digital?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Levi Bettwieser develops found film rolls from his Idaho home, and Dennis Wingo helped rescue early pictures of the moon. But what will happen when historical photos go from analog to digital? http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/02/540914751/from-family-snapshots-to-nasa-photos-archivists-aim-to-solve-preservation-puzzle

item.title: Oh, Snap! Scientists Are Turning People's Food Photos Into Recipes
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Researchers have created an artificial neural network that analyzes an image of a dish and tells you how to make it. Still in the early stages, the technology might help improve our dietary health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Researchers have created an artificial neural network that analyzes an image of a dish and tells you how to make it. Still in the early stages, the technology might help improve our dietary health. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/02/540022733/oh-snap-scientists-are-turning-peoples-food-photos-into-recipes

item.title: This Police Department Is A Smash Hit On Social Media
item.description: August 2, 2017 - They're doing it with memes from Game of Thrones and The Simpsons. And by quickly responding to queries from the public.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - They're doing it with memes from Game of Thrones and The Simpsons. And by quickly responding to queries from the public. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/02/540822294/this-police-department-is-a-smash-hit-on-social-media

item.title: British Airways Apologizes For Delays Caused By Yet Another IT System Failure
item.description: August 2, 2017 - The problem comes after the airline experienced a major information technology outage in May that stranded tens of thousands of passengers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - The problem comes after the airline experienced a major information technology outage in May that stranded tens of thousands of passengers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/02/541102526/british-airways-apologizes-once-again-for-delays-caused-by-it-system-failure

item.title: Coastal Islanders Band Together For Broadband
item.description:
August 2, 2017 - If you've ever dreamed of the good life on one of Maine's coastal islands, be forewarned: the Internet ranges from lousy to nonexistent.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/538605858/coastal-islanders-band-together-for-broadband

item.title: Apple Has Good Sales News For Wall Street
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Investors expected a slowdown in iPhone 7 sales but they were up 1.6 percent year-over-year. Apple also enjoyed iPad and Mac sales well ahead of the overall industry for computers and tablets.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Investors expected a slowdown in iPhone 7 sales but they were up 1.6 percent year-over-year. Apple also enjoyed iPad and Mac sales well ahead of the overall industry for computers and tablets. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/01/541020384/apple-has-good-sales-news-for-wall-street

item.title: Kevin Hart's New Online Comedy Service Joins Crowded Streaming Market
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Kevin Hart is launching a streaming comedy service. The actor's Laugh Out Loud Network, which rolls out this week, enters an already crowded market. LANGUAGE ADVISORY: There are two bleeps in actualities in this piece at :14 and :44 in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
